definition: to be forced to grind grain as a punishment (old)

sentences.english: Chung mud thickening meters more chisel, a ship to ship back to town.
sentences.chinese: 舂得泥稠米更凿，祈船未到镇船回。

sentences.english: Though thou shouldst bray a fool in the mortar, as when a pestle striketh upon sodden barley, his folly would not be taken from him.
sentences.chinese: 你尽可在臼中将愚人舂碎，但他的昏愚却永不能铲除。

sentences.english: In a village not far from here, a woman was cleaning rice.
sentences.chinese: 离此不远的村里，有位女人在舂米。

sentences.english: This is a yellow leaves falling in season, look up, full Shuqing chung.
sentences.chinese: 本该是个黄叶纷飞的季节，仰头，满树青舂。

sentences.english: The farmers pound rice in a mortar.
My mother used to pound the wheat into flour by hand.
sentences.chinese: 我母亲过去总是用手工把小麦舂成面粉。

sentences.english: Prolonged hand movement. To knock, to pound with pestle .
sentences.chinese: 手持久的动作，敲打也，捣舂也。

sentences.english: Yu Chung remaining River rose urgent machines, Willow edge of shore people get wind.
sentences.chinese: 雨馀溪涨急机舂，缘岸人家柳弄风。

sentences.english: My next concern was to get me a stone mortar to stamp or beat some corn in;
sentences.chinese: 下一个问题是我需要一个石臼舂粮食。

definition: (Hakka cuisine) snacks made from glutinous rice flour (rice cakes, noodles etc)
husk/(of a radish etc) spongy (and therefore unappetising)
